resources.string: Welcome to Kali Linux NetHunter, by Offensive Security! This application is designed to make it easier to execute attacks and control services. The navigation menu contains links to useful commands, settings, macros, and attack configuration pages. Most configurations work out of the box but some may require some minimal tweaking.
Various Kali network services can be started and stopped via the buttons in this part of the interface.
The Powersploit payload provides you a choice of reverse meterpreter HTTP/S payloads. "URL to payload" should be a URL accessible to the victim machine where the larger payload is downloaded to.
This Windows CMD payload allows you to enter raw commands to a Windows command prompt. Hitting the list menu will allow you to choose keyboard layout or UAC bypass options.

This is our implementation of the BadUSB attack as demonstrated at Black Hat USA 2014. Enabling this USB mode will turn your device with its OTG USB cable into a network interface when plugged into a target computer. Connecting the USB cable to a PC will force all traffic from that PC (Windows or Linux) through the NetHunter device, where the traffic can be MITM\'ed.
This is the configuration page for MANA, an evil access point implementation by Sensepost. The various MITM logs get written to the /var/lib/mana-toolkit directory in the Kali chroot..
The hostapd configuration file used by Mana.
The dhcpd configuration file used by Mana.
The dnsspoof configuration file used by Mana.
The Mana script that does full NAT & SSL interception.
The Mana script that does full NAT only.
The Mana script that does full NAT & BDFProxy HTTP routing to port 8080.
The Mana no-upstream EAP run script.
Dnsmasq is a lightweight DNS forwarder and DHCP server that can easily be configured to provide DNS and DHCP services to a small network.
hostapd is a user space daemon for wireless access point and authentication servers. You can use hostapd to easily create a wireless access point using these configuration options:

The DuckHunter script can easily convert "USB Rubber Ducky" scripts into NetHunter HID format. You can generate preconfigured scripts at the incredibly useful Ducky Toolkit site, or check out the Rubber Ducky script syntax from the official README
Easily set up NAT or use iptables rules to route traffic.
Error launching intent. Install Android Terminal!

Change the MAC of any network interface.

It can be randomly generated or manually typed. 

The MAC must contain 6 pair of combinations using the charset: [0-9|A-F|a-f] something like:

 00:11:22:ab:cd:ef

This will reset the wlan0 MAC to his original state.

After the reset the phone will be rebooted.

 This is useful if the wifi is stuck with a incompatible MAC address.
The wlan0 interface does not support every combination of MAC addresses, so this feature is disabled for wlan0.\n\nIf your wifi gets stuck, reset the MAC with the menu option.

string-array.name: interface_opts
string-array.item: usb0 (USB > Ethernet for the Nexus7 2013 when tethering | badusb)
